name: Betula
description_brief: This tool helps farmers & advisors to develop an agroforestry plan. Step by step, the user is guided through all aspects that need attention, from goal & species selection to planting & management issues. Betula is part of the Agroforestry Planner.
developers: Bert Reubens (ILVO - https://www.linkedin.com/in/bertreubens/), Sarah Carton (ILVO), Paul Pardon (ILVO), Jolien Bracke (ILVO), Julian Rahahleh (BDB), Tom Coussement (BDB), Sander Van Daele (Bosplus)
organizations: Flanders Research Institute for Agriculture, Fisheries and Food (ILVO), Bosplus vzw, Soil Service of Belgium (BDB)
indicators_comment: It is a decision support tool to design and make choices, but there is no modelling/assessment related.
input_data_protocols: User enters the data directly manually
output_data_formats: Static content (e.g. reports on website pages
tables and graphs in the tool's interface
access_barrier: No, direct download/access through a web link
